main event: A bluish-white light object was observed at Fairchild AFB, Washington on September 3, 1950, and was evaluated as a meteor.
interesting points: The object was about the size of an automobile headlight and emitted sparks before disappearing., The observation lasted only a few seconds., Capt. Fortney did not see the object as he was driving with his sun visor down., Mrs. Fortney reported the light changed size and left a fiery trail in various colors., Major Gardiniar observed three objects in the sky that appeared to be held aloft by an unknown force.
witness description: Mrs. Fortney and Major Gardiniar, among others
